newsitem.title: USA: Orange County bankruptcy jury reaches verdict.
newsitem.headline: Orange County bankruptcy jury reaches verdict.

text.p: The jury in the bankruptcy-related trial of former Orange County, Calif., assistant treasurer Matthew Raabe has reached a verdict, court officials said Friday.
The jury of six men and six women was expected to announce its verdict in Superior Court in Santa Ana within an hour.

County prosecutors allege that Raabe helped to divert nearly $90 million in interest earnings owed to cities, schools and special districts that invested in the county-run investment pool before the county descended into bankruptcy.
Orange County filed for bankruptcy in December 1994 after sustaining losses of more than $1.6 billion on risky investments. The county emerged from bankruptcy last June.
Raabe was indicted by a county grand jury in May 1995 on several felony counts alleging he misappropriated public funds, failed to transfer public funds and made untrue statements in bond documents.
